dialogues.text: She stands, putting the attache case on the sofa next to where she was sitting. Roy, with a faint smile, watches h leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very small, little used. Dark. Lilly switches on the ligh when she enters, then leans against the counter, fists clenched and trembling on the counter in front of her. Sh grits her teeth, hyperventilates, stares around the room search of escape, an answer, something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU, Lilly's face, desperate, grim, but not giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT. Lilly opens cabinets, finds two glasses, opens nearly-empty refrigerator, gets ice cubes from a tray, pu them in the glasses, puts the partial tray back in the freezer compartment, fills the glasses from the cold wate tap, puts the glasses on the counter, stares at them brie She then shakes her head, searches the kitchen some more, finds a cookie sheet she can use as a tray. She puts the glasses on the tray, carries the tray from the room, leav the light on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly enters with the tray, crosses to Roy, presents the glasses, speaks as he reaches for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take whichever one you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates. It hadn't occurred to him Lilly might try t poison him or knock him out. He grins at her and takes a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly takes the other glass, puts the cookie sheet on a table, looks down at Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what I'd do, Roy. You have no idea. To live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easy) Oh, you'll live, Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly crosses back to the sofa, sits beside the attache c pats it absently as though it is a pet and she's glad it didn't move, waited for her. She sips water, puts the gla on the end table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's bugging you, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? I didn't know anything was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (twisted grin) Oh, really? You've got a legitimate complaint, Roy, I don't deny that. I wasn't a very good mother when you were a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full laugh) Not very good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, accepting the correction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad mother. By any standards. I've thought about it, you know, from your side, since then. I know just how bad I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closed against her) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder did you ever think about it from my side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not worth discussing) Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I guess not. It was pretty lousy of me, I guess, to be a child at the same time you were. Not to stop being a child just because I had a child. I guess I was a real stinker not to be a grown-up when you needed a grown-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy didn't expect to be made uncomfortable and defensive, he resents it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Pin a halo on you? You're doing a pretty good job of that yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And making you feel bad at the same time, huh? But that's the way I am, you know, the way I've always been. Always picking on poor little Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Lilly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense) I gave you your life twice. I'm asking you to give me mine once. I need the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not worth discussing) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly subsides back onto the sofa. One hand rests on the attache case. With the other, she sips water, puts the gl back down. Roy watches her, unmoving, expressionless. Lil frowns, not quite looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting off the grift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. You don't really belong on this side of the fence, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you stayed a crook, do you think you'd live to be my ripe age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I got it wrong, then. Seems to me I heard about a guy just your age that got hit so hard in the guts it almost killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy's again unexpectedly uncomfortable. He shifts uneasil his chair, trying to think of a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure, that doesn't count. That's different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn't matter, does it? I'm getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense) And that's why you've got to get rid of this money. If you keep it around, it'll just make you think how clever you are. It'll be a temptation to get back into the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full laugh) Oh, that's it! You're stealing my money for my own good! How very motherly of you, Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, Lilly drops back against the sofa back. Anoth round in the fight is over. Roy watches her, patient, wai for her to give up, seeing no other outcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE on Lilly, frustrated, feeling the need to move, pressure of pursuit. Her head turns back and forth, her b starts false gestures. Finally, abruptly, she gets to her feet, looks at Roy, looks away, picks up the attache case

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU, Roy, alert. He won't let her reach the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE PANNING with Lilly as she prowls the room, pacin back and forth, the attache case swinging at her side. Finally, she stops, standing the attache case on the coff table, her hand still on its handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, attentive without hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I should get out of the racket, that goes double for you. That's why you've got to change your life completely, go to some town, get a square job, live like a john yourself. If you try to do it your way, what future is in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A future. The only future I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money wouldn't last forever. And then what? You'd be back in some other part of the rackets. Another Bobo Justus to slap you around and burn holes in your hands. This way, you've got to go the square route. You could send me a card when you're settled, I could maybe help out sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter laugh) ) That's what it is, isn't it? Keep me down. Your turn to be in charge, have the power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stonewalling) Just trying to help, Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the sofa again, this time leaving the attache case to stand on the coffee table. She studies Roy, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy... What if I told you I wasn't really your mother? That we weren't related?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly leans back again, but this time her manner is different; languorous, sexy. She crosses her legs, the up leg swinging gently. She smiles gently, encouragingly, at Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like that, wouldn't you? Sure you would. You don't need to tell me. Now, why would you like it, Roy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE on Roy, understanding and not wanting to underst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) What's that all about? Of course you're my mother. Of course you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT. Lilly leans forward toward Roy, inviting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very soft) Roy... Roy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy will not let anything complicated come to the surface

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing more to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very soft) I have to have that money, Roy. What do I have to do to get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE on Roy, his face bruised-looking, eyes scared. H will not know what's going on. He shakes his head, not trusting himself to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE on Lilly, leaning forward, tension showing throu the seductive manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Won't you give me the money, Roy? Can't I change your mind? What can I do to change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT, as Lilly gets to her feet and takes a step towa him. Roy's pressed back into his chair, trying to maintai cold facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly, Jesus, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there nothing I can do, Roy, nothing at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn away at the same instant. Roy turns to the side to pick up the glass of water, to break the spell an the tension. Lilly turns back toward the coffee table and picks up the attache case. Roy, lifting the glass to drin turns forward again as Lilly spins forward, swinging the attache case at his head with all her might. The case cra into the glass and into his face. Roy SCREAMS and topples the chair, as the one remaining clasp on the case lets go money goes flying, filling the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGLE DOWN at Roy, face up, expression horrified, hand his throat. A large triangle of glass is in his throat. B pumps thickly, fountaining up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU, Lilly, staring down in horror. She lurches forward, b there's nothing to do. She stares around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU, wads of bills on the floor, getting bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU, Lilly, in agony, but looking down, kicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU, Lilly's feet kicking the bills away from the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT, as Lilly drops to her knees beside Roy, who's already dying. Blood spurts less forcefully. His hands fa to his sides, eyes stare upward, mouth still moves slight Lilly, shoving money away with her hands now, stares at h willing it not to happen. He stops moving. His eyes dull. Lilly clasps her arms around herself. She knows she doesn dare scream. Lips drawn back in a snarl, teeth clenched, HISSES her agony through her teeth. She HISSES; she HISSE she HISSES. Then, slowly, she regains control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as Lilly gets to her feet. She seems dazed now, like someone who's just been in a traffic accident. She blunders around the room, kicks the attache case, bends t pick it up. She studies the clasp, sees it still works, g back to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE, Lilly in f.g., Roy in b.g., as Lilly repacks t money into the case, wiping the blood from some wads onto carpet. Finishing, she closes the case, then remains on h knees, bending over the case. She WEEPS grindingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT, entrance door in b.g. Lilly's weeping subsides She gets wearily to her feet, and leaves the room. CAMERA HOLDS. SOUND of water running in sink. SOUND STOPS. Lilly reappears. She does not again look toward Roy. She picks the attache case, crosses to the door, opens it, steps ac the threshold, reaches back to switch off the light. GO T BLACK.
